noun.description: A person who purchases membership of a society, guild, or company. Compare "redemption". In later use historical.
US. An emigrant to America who paid for the passage by becoming an indentured servant on arrival. Now historical.
Law. A person who redeems mortgaged property or land.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in Ordinance Book Merchants of Staple. From redemption + -er.
